sen.j: 遵西（じゅんさい、生年不詳 - 建永2年2月9日 (旧暦)（1207年3月9日））は、平安時代末期から鎌倉時代初期にかけての浄土宗の僧。
sen.e: Junsai (year of birth unknown - March 9, 1207) is a monk of the Jodo (Pure Land) Sect of Buddhism who lived from the late Heian period to the early Kamakura period
Junsai (year of birth unknown - March 9, 1207) was a monk of the Jodo (Pure Land) Sect of Buddhism who lived from the late Heian period to the early Kamakura period
Junsai (year of birth unknown - March 16, 1207) was a priest of the Jodo (Pure Land) sect of Buddhism who lived from the late Heian period to the early Kamakura period
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に修正しました。

sen.e: His father is NAKAHARA no Morohide.

sen.j: 房名は安楽房（この房名から安楽とも称される）。
sen.e: His bomyo (room name) is Anrakubo (he is also reffered as Anraku from this bomyo).

sen.e: His secular name was NAKAHARA no Morohiro.

sen.j: 当初大蔵卿高階泰経に仕えたが、後出家して法然に師事した。
sen.e: At first he served TAKASHINA no Yasutsune, Okura-kyo (Minister of the Treasury), but later studied under Honen (founder of the Jodo Sect) after becoming a priest.

sen.cmt: sect 小文字にしました。

sen.j: 1192年（建久3年）法然が大和国八道見仏の発願により八坂引導寺で別時念仏を修する際、遵西は住蓮とともに六時礼讃を勤行している。
sen.e: In 1192 when Honen, at the wish of Kenbutsu HACHIDO (a Buddhist monk) of the Yamato Province, dedicated Betsuji nenbutsu (it refers to the practices in which ascetics chant the name of the Buddha and give invocation of the Buddha's name on a fixed date and time) at the Yasaka Indo-ji Temple, Junsai, together with his fellow monk Juren, was engaged in devotional exercises of Rokuji raisan (it refers to devotional exercises where Buddhist monks pray to the Buddha at 6 in the morning and the evening).
sen.cmt: 「八道見仏」の「八道」の読み方を「はちどうけんぶつ」としましたが。http://kotobank.jp/word/%E8%A6%8B%E4%BB%8F 「住蓮とともに」とありますが、２つ下に「同門の住蓮」と説明がありますので、ここで「同門」を追加しました。下の文の「同門」も一応そのままつけました。
sen.e: In 1192 when Honen, at the wish of Kenbutsu HACHIDO (a Buddhist monk) of the Yamato Province, dedicated Betsuji nenbutsu (it refers to the practices in which ascetics chant the name of the Buddha and give invocation of the Buddha's name on a fixed date and time) at the Yasaka Indo-ji Temple, Junsai, together with his fellow monk Juren, was engaged in devotional exercises of Rokuji raisan (it refers to devotional exercises where Buddhist monks pray to the Buddha at 6 in the morning and the evening).

In 1192 when Honen, at the wish of a Buddhist priest named Hachido Kenbutsu of the Yamato Province, dedicated Betsuji nenbutsu (practices in which ascetics chant the name of the Buddha and give invocation of the Buddha's name on a fixed date and time) at the Yasaka Indo-ji Temple, Junsai, together with his fellow priest Juren, was engaged in devotional exercises of Rokuji raisan (devotional exercises where Buddhist priests pray to the Buddha at six in the morning and the evening).
sen.cmt: monk→ priest としました。Six とスペルアウトしました。

sen.j: 1198年（建久9年）法然が選択本願念仏集を撰述する際には、その執筆を命じられている。
sen.e: In 1198 when Honen compiled Senchaku Hongan Nenbutsu Shu (the holy writings of the Jodo-shu Sect), Junsai was ordered to write it.
In 1198 when Honen compiled Senchaku Hongan Nenbutsu Shu (the holy writings of the Jodo-shu Sect), Junsai was ordered to write it.
In 1198 when Honen compiled Senchaku Hongan Nenbutsu Shu (the holy writings of the Jodo sect), Junsai was ordered to write it.

sen.j: 音楽的才能に恵まれ、同門の住蓮とともに六時礼讃に曲節をつけて念仏の信者たちに合唱させ、専修念仏の普及に大きな役割を果たした。
sen.e: Blessed with musical talent, he had followers of the nenbutsu chant the Rokuji raisan in a chorus to a tune he had written with his fellow monk Juren, and thus he played a vital role for spreading Senju Nenbutsu (the Single-Minded Recitation of the Nenbutsu).

sen.j: 後鳥羽天皇の女房たちと密通をはたらいたという嫌疑をかけられ、1207年（建永2年・承元元年）、弟子の僧と共に六条河原で斬首に処せられた。
sen.e: Under suspicion that he committed adultery with court ladies who were serving Emperor Gotoba, he was executed to decapitation along with his disciple monks at the riverbank of Rokujo-gawara in 1207.
sen.cmt: この事件の背景にいるのは「後鳥羽天皇」ではなく、「後鳥羽上皇」のようです。ここでは一応「天皇」として翻訳しました。 浄土真宗親鸞会公式サイトhttp://www.shinrankai.or.jp/b/shinsyu/080519jyougen.htm
sen.e: Under suspicion that he committed adultery with court ladies who were serving Emperor Gotoba, he was executed by decapitation along with his disciple monks at the riverbank of Rokujo-gawara in 1207.

Under suspicion that he committed adultery with court ladies who were serving Emperor Gotoba, he was executed by decapitation along with his disciple priests at the riverbank of Rokujo-gawara in 1207.

sen.j: wikt刎首に先立って羅切された話は有名。
sen.e: It is well known that prior to his funshu (decapitation) punishment, he had been cut off his penis.
It is well known that prior to his funshu (decapitation) punishment, his penis was cut off.
It is well known that prior to his funshu (decapitation) punishment, his penis was cut off.

sen.j: この事件は、法然が讃岐に配流され、親鸞が越後に配流された承元の法難の直接のきっかけとなった。
sen.e: This incident directly triggered Jogen no Honan (an event where four apprentices of Honen were executed and seven others including Honen and Shinran were banished by the Retired Emperor Gotoba) for which Honen was exiled to Oki Island and Shinran to the Echigo Province.
